snippet: The document, quietly presented to the Security Council last week, details torture, abduction and grave abuse of children by both sides in the conflict.
abstract: United Nations report says children as young as age 11 in Syria have been sexually abused in government detention, recruited to fight with the opposition, tortured and used as civilian shields; report is first to assess the impact of Syrian conflict on children.

byline.contributor: Ben Hubbard contributed reporting from Istanbul, and Anne Barnard from Beirut, Lebanon.
